Didn't mention Drew Storen (I hope he doesn't become another Chad Cordero). Desmond and Espinosa need to form a strong infield comboÂ like Rollins and Utley. Zimmerman should shine and I am expecting more from Werth (aren't we all). I don't mind Morse on the DL as he seems to get a slow start. Weak positions are 1B and CF (at least until Harper appears).
Pitching will carry us - I can't imagine Strasburg, Zimmermann, and Gonzales all having bad years (Jackson will eat innings, but I don't expect a lot). As I stated before, I think Lannan will thrive as a 4th or 5th starter - I am not Too hot on Wang (injuries).
Phillies and Braves are on their way down (Mets have owner problems and will be bad). Miami could be really good or bad - too many variables.
Overall, I expect a winning season (over .500), but playoffs will Depend on who else will have a better-than-expected season (e.g., Dodgers) - extra Wild Card helps. If not this year, Nats have a very bright future.
The biggest thrill in baseball is following a team on the rise.
